code: @Manual{,   title = {codexchain: Access Public Medical Coding Data APIs},   author = {Andrew Bruce},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/andrewallenbruce/codexchain, https://andrewallenbruce.github.io/codexchain/}, }

title: Access Public Medical Coding Data APIs
text: can install development version codexchain GitHub :

what: National Library of Medicine’s ICD-10-CM 2023 API
title: Access Public Medical Coding Data APIs
text: International Classification Diseases, 10th Revision, Clinical Modification American modification World Health Organization’s ICD-10, medical coding system classifying diagnoses reasons healthcare visits. Return seven ICD-10-CM codes beginning “A15”  Return first 20 ICD-10-CM codes associated tuberculosis  Return two ICD-10-CM codes associated pleurisy  searching ICD-10-CM codes letter, must set field param “code” search terms containing letter well. example, without field = "code", following returns terms containing letter “Z”:  field = "code", returns codes containing “Z”:
code: codex_icd10(code = "A15") |>       gluedown::md_table() codex_icd10(term = "tuber",              limit = 20) |>              gluedown::md_table() codex_icd10(term = "pleurisy") |>             gluedown::md_table() codex_icd10(code = "Z",              limit = 10) |>     gluedown::md_table() codex_icd10(code = "z",              field = "code",              limit = 10) |>        gluedown::md_table()

previous_headings: National Library of Medicine’s ICD-10-CM 2023 API
title: Access Public Medical Coding Data APIs
code: codex_icd10(term = "bmi adult",              limit = 30) |>    gluedown::md_table() NHANES::NHANES |>    janitor::clean_names() |>    dplyr::filter(age >= 20) |>    dplyr::select(id, gender, age, weight, height) |>    dplyr::slice_sample(n = 20) |>    dplyr::mutate(bmi = codexchain:::calc_bmi(wt = weight, ht = height),                 icd_10_code = codexchain:::assign_bmi_icd(bmi),                 bmi_status = codexchain:::assign_bmi_status(bmi)) |>    gluedown::md_table()

title: Access Public Medical Coding Data APIs
text: Pneumonia infection one lungs. causes air sacs lungs fill fluid pus. can range mild severe, depending type germ causing infection, age, overall health. causes pneumonia? Bacterial, viral, fungal infections can cause pneumonia. Bacteria common cause. Bacterial pneumonia can occur . can also develop ’ve certain viral infections cold flu. Several different types bacteria can cause pneumonia, including: • Streptococcus pneumoniae • Legionella pneumophila; pneumonia often called Legionnaires’ disease • Mycoplasma pneumoniae • Chlamydia pneumoniae • Haemophilus influenzae Viruses infect respiratory tract may cause pneumonia. Viral pneumonia often mild goes away within weeks. sometimes serious enough need get treatment hospital. viral pneumonia, risk also getting bacterial pneumonia. different viruses can cause pneumonia include: • Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) • common cold flu viruses • SARS-CoV-2, virus causes COVID-19 Fungal pneumonia common people chronic health problems weakened immune systems. types include: • Pneumocystis pneumonia (PCP) • Coccidioidomycosis, causes valley fever • Histoplasmosis • Cryptococcus risk pneumonia? Anyone can get pneumonia, certain factors can increase risk: • Age; risk higher children age 2 adults age 65 older • Exposure certain chemicals, pollutants, toxic fumes • Lifestyle habits, smoking, heavy alcohol use, malnourishment • hospital, especially ICU. sedated /ventilator raises risk even . • lung disease • weakened immune system • trouble coughing swallowing, stroke condition • Recently sick cold flu symptoms pneumonia? symptoms pneumonia can range mild severe include: • Fever • Chills • Cough, usually phlegm (slimy substance deep lungs) • Shortness breath • Chest pain breathe cough • Nausea /vomiting • Diarrhea symptoms can vary different groups. Newborns infants may show signs infection. Others may vomit fever cough. might seem sick, energy, restless. Older adults people serious illnesses weak immune systems may fewer milder symptoms. may even lower normal temperature. Older adults pneumonia sometimes sudden changes mental awareness. problems can pneumonia cause? Sometimes pneumonia can cause serious complications : • Bacteremia, happens bacteria move bloodstream. serious can lead septic shock. • Lung abscesses, collections pus cavities lungs • Pleural disorders, conditions affect pleura. pleura tissue covers outside lungs lines inside chest cavity. • Kidney failure • Respiratory failure pneumonia diagnosed? Sometimes pneumonia can hard diagnose. can cause symptoms cold flu. may take time realize serious condition. health care provider may use many tools make diagnosis: • medical history, includes asking symptoms • physical exam, including listening lungs stethoscope • Various tests, • chest x-ray • Blood tests complete blood count (CBC) see immune system actively fighting infection • Blood culture find whether bacterial infection spread bloodstream hospital, serious symptoms, older, health problems, may also tests, : • Sputum test, checks bacteria sample sputum (spit) phlegm (slimy substance deep lungs). • Chest CT scan see much lungs affected. may also show complications lung abscesses pleural effusions. • Pleural fluid culture, checks bacteria fluid sample taken pleural space • Pulse oximetry blood oxygen level test, check much oxygen blood • Bronchoscopy, procedure used look inside lungs’ airways treatments pneumonia? Treatment pneumonia depends type pneumonia, germ causing , severe : • Antibiotics treat bacterial pneumonia types fungal pneumonia. work viral pneumonia. • cases, provider may prescribe antiviral medicines viral pneumonia • Antifungal medicines treat types fungal pneumonia may need treated hospital symptoms severe risk complications. , may get additional treatments. example, blood oxygen level low, may receive oxygen therapy. may take time recover pneumonia. people feel better within week. people, can take month . Can pneumonia prevented? Vaccines can help prevent pneumonia caused pneumococcal bacteria flu virus. good hygiene, smoking, healthy lifestyle may also help prevent pneumonia. NIH: National Heart, Lung, Blood Institute |
code: rx <- codex_medline(code_title = "Chantix 0.5 MG Oral Tablet",                code_system = "rxcui")  rx |>    #dplyr::mutate(entry_summary = stringr::str_wrap(entry_summary)) |>    dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(everything(), as.character)) |>    tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = dplyr::everything()) |>    gluedown::md_table() sno <- codex_medline(code = "41381004",                code_title = "Pneumonia due to Pseudomonas",                code_system = "snomed")  sno |>    #dplyr::mutate(entry_summary = stringr::str_wrap(entry_summary)) |>    dplyr::mutate(dplyr::across(everything(), as.character)) |>    tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = dplyr::everything()) |>    gluedown::md_table()

code: codex_ptp() |>    head() |>    dplyr::select(-record_number) |>    gluedown::md_table() codex_ptp(explain = TRUE) |>    head() |>    dplyr::select(-record_number) |>    gluedown::md_table()

what: Search the Medicare Fee-for-Service Comprehensive Error Rate Testing API — codex_cert
title: Search the Medicare Fee-for-Service Comprehensive Error Rate Testing API — codex_cert
text: Information Medicare Fee--Service (FFS) claims underwent Comprehensive Error Rate Testing (CERT) medical review. claims used calculate Medicare FFS improper payment rate.

title: Search the Medicare Fee-for-Service Comprehensive Error Rate Testing API — codex_cert
code: codex_cert(   year = 2021,   part = NULL,   drg = NULL,   hcpcs = NULL,   prov_type = NULL,   bill_type = NULL,   decision = NULL,   error = NULL,   clean_names = TRUE,   lowercase = TRUE )

title: Search the Medicare Fee-for-Service Comprehensive Error Rate Testing API — codex_cert
text: Centers Medicare & Medicaid Services

title: Search the Medicare Fee-for-Service Comprehensive Error Rate Testing API — codex_cert
text: year YYYY, calendar year CERT data. 2011-2021 data currently available. part Type Medicare Fee--Service claim drg Diagnosis Related Group code hcpcs Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System code prov_type Type provider providing service bill_type Type Bill (TOB), Identifies type facility, type care, sequence bill particular episode care; e.g. "721", "131", "110", "111" decision Medical review decision claim; either Agree Disagree error Reason claim error; e.g. "Insufficient Documentation", "Incorrect Coding" clean_names Clean column names janitor's clean_names() function; default TRUE. lowercase Convert column names lowercase; default TRUE.

title: Search the Medicare Fee-for-Service Comprehensive Error Rate Testing API — codex_cert
text: tibble containing search results.

title: Search the Medicare Fee-for-Service Comprehensive Error Rate Testing API — codex_cert
text: Medicare Fee--Service (FFS) Comprehensive Error Rate Testing (CERT) dataset provides information random sample FFS claims determine paid properly Medicare coverage, coding, payment rules. dataset contains information type FFS claim, Diagnosis Related Group (DRG) Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) codes, provider type, type bill, review decision, error code. Please note, reporting year contains claims submitted July 1 two years report June 30 one year report. example, 2021 data contains claims submitted July 1, 2019 June 30, 2020.

title: Search the National Library of Medicine's ICD-10-CM API — codex_icd10
code: # Returns the seven codes beginning with "A15" codex_icd10(code = "A15") #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   icd_10_cm_code icd_10_cm_term                               #>   <chr>          <chr>                                        #> 1 A15.0          Tuberculosis of lung                         #> 2 A15.4          Tuberculosis of intrathoracic lymph nodes    #> 3 A15.5          Tuberculosis of larynx, trachea and bronchus #> 4 A15.6          Tuberculous pleurisy                         #> 5 A15.7          Primary respiratory tuberculosis             #> 6 A15.8          Other respiratory tuberculosis               #> 7 A15.9          Respiratory tuberculosis unspecified          # Returns the first five codes associated with tuberculosis codex_icd10(term = "tuber", limit = 5) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   icd_10_cm_code icd_10_cm_term                               #>   <chr>          <chr>                                        #> 1 A15.0          Tuberculosis of lung                         #> 2 A15.4          Tuberculosis of intrathoracic lymph nodes    #> 3 A15.5          Tuberculosis of larynx, trachea and bronchus #> 4 A15.6          Tuberculous pleurisy                         #> 5 A15.7          Primary respiratory tuberculosis              # Returns the two codes associated with pleurisy codex_icd10(term = "pleurisy") #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   icd_10_cm_code icd_10_cm_term       #>   <chr>          <chr>                #> 1 R09.1          Pleurisy             #> 2 A15.6          Tuberculous pleurisy  # If you're searching for codes beginning with a certain letter, you # must set the `field` param to "code" or it will search for terms as well:  # Returns terms containing the letter "Z" codex_icd10(code = "z", limit = 5) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>   icd_10_cm_code icd_10_cm_term                                                  #>   <chr>          <chr>                                                           #> 1 A28.8          Other specified zoonotic bacterial diseases, not elsewhere cla… #> 2 A28.9          Zoonotic bacterial disease, unspecified                         #> 3 A92.5          Zika virus disease                                              #> 4 B02.0          Zoster encephalitis                                             #> 5 B02.1          Zoster meningitis                                                # Returns codes beginning with "Z" codex_icd10(code = "z", field = "code") #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    icd_10_cm_code icd_10_cm_term                                                 #>    <chr>          <chr>                                                          #>  1 Z00.00         Encounter for general adult medical examination without abnor… #>  2 Z00.01         Encounter for general adult medical examination with abnormal… #>  3 Z00.110        Health examination for newborn under 8 days old                #>  4 Z00.111        Health examination for newborn 8 to 28 days old                #>  5 Z00.121        Encounter for routine child health examination with abnormal … #>  6 Z00.129        Encounter for routine child health examination without abnorm… #>  7 Z00.2          Encounter for examination for period of rapid growth in child… #>  8 Z00.3          Encounter for examination for adolescent development state     #>  9 Z00.5          Encounter for examination of potential donor of organ and tis… #> 10 Z00.6          Encounter for examination for normal comparison and control i…

title: Search CMS' NCCI Medically Unlikely Edits (MUEs) API — codex_mue
text: Medically Unlikely Edits (MUEs) define HCPCS / CPT code maximum units service (UOS) provider report circumstances single beneficiary single date service. Practitioner services also refers ambulatory surgical centers. DME refers provider claims durable medical equipment. CMS National Correct Coding Initiative (NCCI) promotes national correct coding methodologies reduces improper coding may result inappropriate payments Medicare Part B claims Medicaid claims. NCCI procedure--procedure (PTP) edits define pairs Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS)/Current Procedural Terminology (CPT) codes reported together variety reasons. purpose PTP edits prevent improper payments incorrect code combinations reported. edits dataset active dates indicated within. file used state Medicaid programs edit file. information, visit https://www.medicaid.gov/medicaid/program-integrity/ncci/index.html.
